title: ICE: stack overflow in resolver

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust use crate::*; fn main() { use _::*; } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (696aaad58 2023-04-09) binary: rustc commit-hash: 696aaad58c57a589f6fb2ecff5bae2eec581cb71 commit-date: 2023-04-09 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.2 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace

``` error: expected identifier, found reserved identifier `_` --> /tmp/treereduce.out:4:9 | 4 | use _::*; | ^ expected identifier, found reserved identifier Thread 2 "rustc" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault. [Switching to Thread 0x7fffe9dff6c0 (LWP 3656741)] 0x00007ffff534e571 in ::resolve_ident_in_module_unadjusted_ext () from
